title: Novelist George Eliot’s Former South London Home Asking £2.8M
text:
Holly Lodge, a three-story brick row house in Putney, London, and former residence of renowned novelist George Eliot, hit the market Thursday asking £2.795 million (US$3.44 million).

Mary Ann Evans, better known by her pen name George Eliot, moved into the spacious terraced house on Wimbledon Park Road in early 1859. It was there, in the sun-filled house with views over South London and its own spacious garden, that she wrote her second book, a semi-autobiographical novel “The Mill on the Floss,” according to English Heritage,...
description: The master of English fiction wrote her second novel from the airy brick-terraced house in Putney
